column5: Had some plans in place to fish with some family members this coming Saturday. Some circumstances have come up and might not be going any where. I then thought about Lake Ontario for a short fish in the morning perhaps. Would be heading out of Whitby most likely and was wondering if anyone had some suggestions as to depths and colours that have been working. Shoot me a PM if you like. Won't know if I'm going until the last minute. I'll be running dipsey's and leadcore, no riggers on the boat.  Thanks
ill be on lake ontario also.....fish are staging so stick close to the river mouths....most are being caught within 30ft to about 100'.....good luck....might see ya out there...
I cant figure out how to PM you, but I don't want to post the info here!
go to his profile....and youll see a tab....send message to.....
I tried that, but there is no tab that says "send message to"  can you PM someone who is not on your friends list?
Tried to send you a PM and says you can't use the messaging system.  Might want to contact one of the administrators.
I just sent you a couple of PM's, I am an idiot, I had my setting so that I had PM's disabled
Want company Saturday?  I happen to be free lol.
I might try and chuck a spoon or two this weekend from shore and see how I do...
I was thinking the same thing, maybe even tonight! I wanted to go out last night, but I didn't want to stand outside with a 9' graphite rod to catch all of that lightning!
why not?  then it becomes a REAL sport!  hum, I might head to Whitby tonight too now that you have me thinking about it...
Heading out tomorrow out of Bronte.. If it's good i'll throw up a post!
Get that amazing net wet Will!  I heard rumblings of dredging bottom off the mouths wrking well recently.
Will,  If it helps, Lake Michigan they are currently staging 30-70 feet, all colors doing well and they are running big
Some good info posted here, and I'm sure some better sent via PM. I was out last night and got skunked, only one knock off. I wish I could help you out.

ill be out in the kayak this weekend again... we usually hit bronte but were gonna be camping out in port elgin this weekend... if you ever see a couple khaki coloured kayaks out in bronte swing by and say hi

This board is such a great place.  Thanks for all the responses and PM's, very much appreciated.  Cliff, boat is full unfortunately, if I get out there. Mom did have a bit of a spell similar to what she had a couple of months ago. She was in the hospital yesterday but was released as all of the tests came back fine. I'll see how she is doing today before I make up my mind whether to go or not. I was going to head to the Kawartha's but am thinking Lake O for the shorter drive just in case.  Phil - that net is amazing. I can get 3 cats and a dog in it no problem... Gotta get a big fish to test it out the right way though.  Carole - NICE FISH!!
